channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mark Cuban-Backed Boozy Juice Box Brand Is About to Get a Massive Payday From a Struggling Beer Giant
item.description: The company caught Cuban’s attention on Shark Tank.

item.title: Watch Out for ‘Ghost Listings’ in the Jobs Forecast
item.description: A new analysis of government job data finds nearly a third of all work opportunities are dead-end positions that were never filled.

item.title: The OBBBA has a significant tax change for founders tucked away inside, lifting the cap to $75 million with many opportunities to turbo-charge business
item.description: The QSBS reforms in the OBBBA are more than just tax tweaks—they’re a strategic invitation to growth, raising capital and exiting.

item.title: Tips for building an emergency fund from financial experts

item.title: Home Depot says a deep funk in the housing market is responsible for its sales slump: ‘Our customers are homeowners’
item.description: The U.S. housing market is currently experiencing historic stagnation.

item.title: Experts Say 1 Unique Trait Made Larry Ellison One of the Richest Men in the World
item.description: His company, Oracle, has emerged as a leader in AI.

item.title: How Badly Handled Layoff News Could Haunt Your Business Later
item.description: No business owner enjoys big cuts to headcount, but a new survey says the way staff reductions are shared has a huge impact on company reputation.

item.title: This Sam Altman Startup Might Have the Most Brutal Work Culture in Silicon Valley
item.description: Altman’s biometrics startup, Tools for Humanity, told employees that they’re ‘always on call.’
